Posts.Content: I think the side effects of F outweighed the benefits so they took it out?  Thsts what I was told ;-)
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks again for all the info.. Off to google R1 abd R2 water gel now lol,!  Glad you're a few steps ahead of me!!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Jo36.. Any idea what dose docetaxel  you were on?   I  Know each treatment nt is different  but short of stronger painkilkers  Im already  considering my next requests. Lol!!!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Someone posted on here re Staffordshire  uni Hospital and also a lady from Ireland...They had cool pads  same duration of time as coolcaps  strapped onto feet /hands during   treatment  This was for  Docetaxol. .  There is a small trial which you can prob google which showed decent results. depends whether your centre  would do this. I bought some gel insoles and stuck in freezer and popped into  my roomy slipper boots just before treatment and a couple of icepacks for placing hands on (covers in wee bag) Dont think they noticed or they didn't comment but like you I want to try my best prevent neuropathy .Failing that I came across this advice from a link posted here. Think this was for when you get home for first week(if treatment 3 weeks apart) place  palms of your hands .soles of your feet on ice pack  (or froze peas) for 15-20 mins   or slip frozen gel  insoles in to shoes.  Or Soak hand feet in cold water for 15-20 mins 3-4 times daily if poss  only follow these instructions week after treatment   Maybe  check posts as this was just from screen shot. Good luck! You've been through so much!!xx p.s. Just reread your post I have heard the weekly Taxol isn't as brutal(Im on 3 weekly dose) so may help you...If I were you I'd buy the gel insole for treatment..even take coolpacks  and use during treatment or for an hour when you get home? Excuse my explanation as just had chemo yesterday so bit fuzzy around the edges lol!!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Scriptfan, Congratulations, how lovely !! I became a gran 4 months after diagnosis and  just before this chemo crap  started Can't wait for it to finish so I can visit more  often . A wonderful boost  for the family, a precious  new life   So pleased you'll be well on the way to recovery by the time your wee bundle arrives   Exciting times ahead. Its lovely to hear  such brilliant l news.  Xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Kiwi -h,I'm afraid this for me is a problem too..steroids  stop me sleeping at all.. I just lie awake listening to talking books. Throughout the whole process I have slept badly..due to stress as well I suppose,or painful feet legs stomach etc I never even thought about asking for sleeping tablets. I am tired but dont sleep,others seem to sleep a lot.. I hope it settles after the worse SE's are over for you . I'm currently on my good week so eating too much;-)
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Oh Coley 1993, my heart goes out to you!! I can.t really add to your comments as you seem to be working it out. I understand  your scenario as Im on a randomised trial, but pulled the short srtaw so am getting chemo too. Other choice was radiotherapy and tablets, no chemo. I think no matter what you decide, you will get through this year a much stronger person  and you will have clear goals in life.You have done so well but the chemo knocks the stuffing out if you and suddenly you are ill!! Its crap!  I agree that feedback from oncology can be frustating but as someone here said ask for what you want, write it down so you dont forget as others can forget too easily and you want the best for you body. Good luck whatever you decide  Take care of yourselfxxx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi teenytaters, No one can stop  you with cold cap!  Its your decision  I am the same and my oncologist said continue as most  mixes have a hairloss effect. I  have little hair left but a fringe and back of head, sides patchy with length. I do wear a wig but can  get off with beanie with some hair showing. Already some new stuff growing in on top. I m on second last treatment and hair loss a lot less.. I do wonder  if the design were better and cap was snug there shoukd be as much hairloss ss on top. Need  eome girl power on the job  Stay strong  its so i hard especially for youngsters  be proud if yourself as we are of you!! Well done for making it this far!! xxxx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Thanks.. Annjac Aching more now and taking paracetamol and ibuprofen  as instructed wiith little effect Still got sore throat and glands  and am wary of infection being masked.. I"ll see if things improve when i get up. Found some heat pouhes  for my stomach which help. IVE GOT  two docetaxel.to go.. Xx
Posts.Title: First Docetaxal

Posts.Content: Thanks Script fan  xx
Posts.Title: First Docetaxal

Posts.Content: Well  ,Still had the awful nausea with this one on Friday but only lasted  during treatment and day after rather than whole week with EC.. Aching all over(esp tummy at night)  but taking the tablets!!   Eventually got tooth checked yet again yesterday by( dental hospital  this time) so decision is extraction   week before next chemo on 21st Dec.Means I can get started on Bisphosphonates.. Got a horrid mouth and a bit of a sore throat but otherwise trying to get some things done.I think  I need to keep moving..takes my mind of the joint pain..   No hand and feet tingling yet so fingers crossed.
Posts.Title: First Docetaxal

Posts.Content: Thanks Ruby Rose. I let the  drugs wear off and then checked temp.. Seems ok. Definitely better being occupied. I did post some letters but it  was like a skating rink outside !.. So currently  putting on a wee log fire. Oisy is the way to go:-) xxx
Posts.Title: First Docetaxal

Posts.Content: Hi, I agree, chemo is the hardest part.. Ive just finished  radiotherapy which was much easier. Surgery wasn't nice especially having to go back "under the knife:" another twice... But  you'll get there.. Im so pleased to be on to letrozole and although there are some side effects I can see light at the end of the tunnel.. Keep smiling xxx
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi there miss Wolfie. you will make it!! I had EC three weekly but not the weekly treatments but I've heard they are more bearable. Others on page can tell you better.. There seems to be conflicting ideas about fasting or feeding before chemo. I tried fasting beforehand and was so ill and miserable I didn't try again. Others report eating well beforehand . Certainly worked better for me but every body is different. Probably worth checking the threads.. The injections can be horrid too but  SE only last during the week you use them. Think flu like symptoms and bone pain.. But they are boosting your immunity. Be prepared with painkilkers and curl up  cosy, I used heat pads as well, look after your self,Hugsxxx
Posts.Title: ***March 2019 Breast Cancer Chem Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi Mrs 50,I had dry eyes which ironically gave me watery eyes.. I was given drops by oncologist. My eyes would stream like tears and my nose l ran ike a burn lol!! "I lost lashes after chemo but my eyes bothered me before that, maybe caused by steroids? I'm 2weeks post radiotherapy now and my eyes seem to be returning to normal.. Sadly not the lashes yetXxx

Posts.Content: Hi, i think youve taken the best route, wish I had, means you can get on with treatment to prevent reoccurrence. Im 4 months since biiosy, lumopctomy, two futher excisiond. ONLY saw oncologist 2 weeks ago. Short straw for Optima trial so first chemo yesterday. Wasnt so bad. Was told the Onco DX test not for me  for some reason. You may need radiotherapy to, but it doesnt sound so bad on the scale of things. I wish you all the best xx
Posts.Title: Second Operation

Posts.Content: Just noticed this,a bit tardy in commenting but I too had wide excision and lumpectomy,was assured they would take plenty away  when I swithered about mastectomy,and resconstruction They left drain in 7 days so resultant sepsis ,two more excisions later,thankfully clear now.But as you say it was like a punch in guts both times and if they'd said 40% need further surgery I'd be well on my journey now if Id opted for mastectomy.As it is 4 months since biopsy ,unsucessfull for Optima trial in avoiding chemo,got into the wrong group;-( I started first  chemo treatment yesterday!.. Picked up a few tips here so all good.
Posts.Title: Second Operation

Posts.Content: Hi I've been told today  Ill  need chaemo but that the oncologist will tell me about the OPTIMA trial..What does this involve? Could there be a chance it may not happen(slim)? I'm er pr positive her neg with 5 node involvement
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Hi,my diagnosis sounds a lot like yours,all be it bigger tumour only in one breast and node,just had surgery..not got a plan yet but was hoping to escape chaemo..I'll find out tomorrow;-(
Posts.Title: **** July Breast Cancer Chemo Club ****

Posts.Content: Good to know as starting tomorrow.. Ill take  my drugs with me just in case,very little info given to me so this all helps..in fact only got info re wigs 2 weeks ago and only discovered today that I was not accepted Optima trial.  Bloods taken by nurse...then Doctor came along and took me to get height measurement.,commented as we arrived at consulting  room that I would gather I was not on trial as I'd had bloods and height taken!! then told me Chemo tomorrow...aggh
Posts.Title: * * * SEPTEMBER BREAST CANCER CHEMO CLUB * * *

Posts.Content: Bloods were ok for second cycle, ironically I had  just been to dentist and got final ok for biphosfonates when this flared up. Consultant suggested dental treatment on  last week before next chemo and I have white cell boosting injections for next week. Dental app tomorrow to discuss. Really could l have done without this but fingers crossed  Thanks for your reply xx
Posts.Title: dental treatment

Posts.Content: Hi,I had horrendous toothache after first chemo.Oncologist given me WBC booster injections to get treatment before next chemo for fear of sepsis.I could wait til en,.4 sessions to go but scared of reoccurence  of  toothache Has anyone else had root canal treatment during chemo?
Posts.Title: dental treatment
